tuv.seg: The President is the title given to the Irish head of State
Tugtar an teideal Uachtarán ar cheann Stáit na hÉireann
As head of State, the President has a number of important functions
Mar cheann Stáit, tá roinnt feidhmeanna tábhachtacha ag Uachtarán
The office of the President is established by the Constitution
Is é Bunreacht na hÉireann a bhunaigh oifig Uachtarán na hÉireann
You can find information on the current and former Presidents here
Tá eolais ar an Uachtarán láithreach anseo
The President is elected directly by the people of Ireland and may be removed from office by either House of the Oireachtas (the Dail and the Seanad)
Déanann muintir na hÉireann an tUachtarán a thogh go díreach agus is féidir le ceachtar de Thithe an Oireachtais an tUachtarán a chur as oifig
The term of office is 7 years and the President may not serve more than 2 terms
Seacht mbliana atá sa téarma oifige agus ní féidir leis an Uachtarán níos mó ná dhá théarma a chur isteach
The President is assisted in performing their duties by the Presidential Commission and the Council of State
Tugann Coimisiún an Uachtaráin agus an Chomhairle Stáit cúnamh don Uachtarán a c(h)uid feidhmneanna a chur i gcrích
The President resides at the official residence, called Áras an Uachtaráin, which is located in the Phoenix Park, one of the largest enclosed parks in Europe
Tá cónaí ar an Uachtarán san áit chónaithe oifigiúil, ar a dtugtar 'Áras an Uachtaráin’, atá lonnaithe i bPáirc an Fhionnuisce. Seo í ceann de na páirceanna iata is mó san Eoraip
The Áras an Uachtaráin website has more information and includes a virtual tour of the residence
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar láithreán gréasáin Áras an Uachtaráin agus áiríonn sé turas fíorúil den áit chónaithe
